meanings.definition: To pry open or force with a crowbar.
meanings.sent1: He crowbarred the old crate open to see what was inside.
meanings.sent2: The workers crowbarred the door to rescue the trapped cat.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoon crowbarred the lid off the trash can for a late-night snack.
meanings.sent4: Her determination crowbarred through the obstacles in her path.
meanings.sent5: The image of the superhero crowbarred the heavy stone slab effortlessly.
